p: The use of plants in toxicity tests offers several advantages, among them low maintenance cost and rapid results, with a special benefit assessment of the potential eco-toxic compounds in terrestrial environments [ 58, 59]. In this study, the germination index (GI), which combines measures of relative seed germination and relative root elongation [ 2, 43, 60], has been used to evaluate the toxicity of the biosurfactant on cabbage ( B. oleracea), and the results are represented in Fig.Â 7.
